intro: Ochthocosmus cuanzensis, commonly known as the Cuanzensis Ceropegia, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone areas, adapting to arid and semi-arid environments. Its leaves are often fleshy and succulent, which help it conserve water. The flowers are usually pale green or yellowish, with a unique structure that attracts specific pollinators.
